title: Naming Bank of England runners could shake financial markets, Chancellor Sajid Javid claims
text:
Chancellor Sajid Javid is refusing to publish a shortlist of candidates for the job of Bank of England Governor because he fears it would throw financial markets into turmoil.

Mr Javid refused to make candidates' names public in a letter responding to cross-party calls from MPs for a more transparent appointment process.

He revealed the Treasury is concerned that giving details could spark a betting frenzy by traders over who was ahead in the race and what this might mean for interest rates. This could trigger wild swings in the pound and stock market.
